info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 6 at 1:08PM EDT until June 6 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of southeast Maryland, including the following counties, Somerset and Worcester and southeast Virginia, including the following county, Accomack.
* WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 106 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain since this morning. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen, with local amounts in excess of 3 inches near Wallops Island. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pocomoke City, Princess Anne, University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, Snow Hill, Parksley, West Pocomoke, Marion Station, Westover, Bloxom, Saxis, Hallwood, Beaver Dam, New Church, Oak Hall, Shelltown, Goodwill, Rehobeth, Horntown, Temperanceville and Cokesbury. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Somerset, MD; Worcester, MD; Accomack, VA
